core_principle: Assume educational intent. Provide structure for due diligence. Document compliance efforts.

clips.description: Individual video clips submitted for citation

source.description: Whether user uploaded file or linked to existing video
source.linkedUrl: string (if LINK type, the URL to original)

auto_applied.title: string (film/show title, auto-detected or user-corrected)
auto_applied.copyrightHolder: string (detected from database or user input)

user_submitted.description: string (what is this clip showing/why does it matter)
user_submitted.purpose: enum (ACADEMIC_ESSAY | DISCUSSION | COMMENTARY | ANALYSIS | CULTURAL_REFERENCE | OTHER)
user_submitted.subject: string (trending/category tag)

compliance.userAcknowledgment: boolean (user confirmed they understand fair use and DMCA)

userResponse.evidence: array of strings (links to their analysis/essay using the clip)

key_design_principles.1_assume_good_faith: Default assumption is educational/commentary use unless proven otherwise
key_design_principles.2_document_everything: All metadata, claims, and responses are documented for legal clarity
key_design_principles.3_user_notification: Users are notified of DMCA claims and can respond with fair use arguments
key_design_principles.4_transparency: Copyright claims are visible in clip metadata, showing good faith compliance
key_design_principles.5_no_automation: No automated takedowns. All claims require review and user opportunity to respond
key_design_principles.6_fair_use_support: Platform provides structure that strengthens fair use defense if challenged
